@biglesp Yes, for a brief period we considered ditching the plan to buy in London. Instead we looked at a guest house in middle of nowhere. Cheaper, and had a revenue income. Only down side was that we know nothing about the industry. Nothing at all.
@mutzumstrich I know, interesting thought experiment isn't it. What would you do now, if in the same position. The choices are expanding all the time.

@biglesp Totally, I've pivoted a few times, from 3d animator, to UX, to product mgt, to strategy, to co-founder. All with an undercurrent of development. I once nearly started a hotel (thats a convo to have over beers).

In my late teens I spend a lot of time gaming and learning 3D modeling and animation. I had my sight on working in TV special effects (which I achieved!) But would I have gone down that route if I could have made a living building assets for the Metaverse from home?
@GtoTheNextLevel https://t.co/xLS4H6BR50

@cloudsonpluto @mave99a @marygooneratne The validation protocols are going  on-chain (via Chainlink) and open source allowing anyone to build their own and to use the RoA NFT structures. We run KYC due the nature of the Learn to Earn platform, but the protocol itself is user agnostic. White paper is coming soon.

@metaesther42 I'd argue that the seeds of Web3 have been around since the beginning of the internet. A decentralised world in which people could build communities, live, learn, love and trade. It's just taken a while to get here.

@cloudsonpluto @mave99a @marygooneratne Good question. In our case we also provide the courses and assessments, so can verify (on-chain) a course pass  before putting the achievement data on-chain. Giving us a transparent audit log connecting course provider / learner with achievement.
@marygooneratne Makes total sense for you records of achievements to be owned by the individual, and on-chain. We are building a platform to enable exactly that.
@mave99a @marygooneratne Replacing CV's with a on-chain record of achievement is exactly what we are building. Initially tied to our own leaning content, but with aim to open up the platform.
If you have an interesting story to tell about Web3, the Metaverse or the future of tech and society ping me. I'm interested in all angles, including the criticisms.

We have just doubled the size of our product/tech team, and are sprinting to the our next product beta release. Very much still focusing on lean product principles, but balancing that with hyper growth in mind. I love this space.

@metaesther42 @RPJNFT @OVioHQ @jamie247 @bearhxg @GlamBeckettArt @sad_girls_bar @toxsam @polygonalmind @cryptoavatarsio @HundoCareers @ASychov @SomniumSpace @TheGlitches_ @JamfactoryNFT My profile name is a different story. I find it very difficult to move away from my IRL identify. A name can also generate more bias than an image. As we develop 
@HundoCareers we are getting different viewpoints people's relationships with avatars. A very important topic.

@metaesther42 @RPJNFT @OVioHQ @jamie247 @bearhxg @GlamBeckettArt @sad_girls_bar @toxsam @polygonalmind @cryptoavatarsio @HundoCareers @ASychov @SomniumSpace Great conversation. I've never seen my profile pic on social as a representation of my identity. I wear profiles as a I would a branded t-shirt. For instance I'm wearing @TheGlitches_ now, but recently changed out of a @JamfactoryNFT.
@balajis Working through this exact use case with @giovannidisiena . Very interested to hear other approaches.

Ok, finally jumped in to have a go. Not the worst first attempt.
